Class RtmApiAuthenticator

java.lang.Object
  it.bova.rtmapi.RtmApiAuthenticator

public class RtmApiAuthenticator
extends Object

The API with the methods for getting and checking the server token.

Author:
Giovanni Pini

                          RtmApiException,

Returns a frob string to be used during authentication.

the frob string
Throws:
ServerException - if server answer with an error message
RtmApiException - API fatal error
IOException - if server is unreachable for many reasons
ParsingException - if the response format is bad

authGetToken

public Token authGetToken(String frob)
                   throws ServerException,
                          RtmApiException,
                          IOException,
                          ParsingException
Returns the auth token for the given frob, if one has been attached.

Parameters:
frob - The frob to check
Returns:
the RtmToken object containing the token string and other useful user information
Throws:
ServerException - if server answer with an error message
RtmApiException - API fatal error
IOException - if server is unreachable for many reasons
ParsingException - if the response format is bad

                     throws ServerException,
                            RtmApiException,
                            IOException,
                            ParsingException
Retrievs the credentials attached to an authentication token.

Parameters:
authToken - The string token to check
Returns:
the RtmToken object, if token is correct and valid
Throws:
ServerException - if server answer with an error message
RtmApiException - API fatal error

ParsingException - if the response format is bad

getToken

public Token getToken()
Gets the auth token, if one is available

Returns:
the auth token if one was get by authGetToken or authCheckToken, otherwise null.
